The outer surface of the valves is covered with concentric growth lines. It is whitish, while the outermost layer of the valves ([[periostracum]]) may be yellowish, light olive or dark brown. The hinge of the left valve shows a spoon-shaped projection, to which the ligaments are attached. The [[pallial sinus]] is deep and broad.<ref name=AA/><ref>[http://species-identification.org/species.php?species_group=mollusca&id=813 Marine Species Identification]</ref>
The outer surface of the valves is covered with concentric growth lines. It is whitish, while the outermost layer of the valves ([[periostracum]]) may be yellowish, light olive or dark brown. The hinge of the left valve shows a spoon-shaped projection, to which the ligaments are attached. The [[pallial sinus]] is deep and broad.<ref name=AA/><ref>[http://species-identification.org/species.php?species_group=mollusca&id=813 Marine Species Identification]</ref>

Following the establishment of the [[Estado Novo (Brazil)|Estado Novo]], Mesquita Filho was arrested several times and once again forced into exhile, spending many years in [[Paris]] and [[Buenos Aires]]. With the advent of the [[Fourth Brazilian Republic]], Mesquita Filho positioned himself as an opponent of the populist [[Brazilian Labour Party (1945)|Brazilian Labour Party]] as well as a critic of the conservative [[National Democratic Union (Brazil)|National Democratic Union]].
Following the establishment of the [[Estado Novo (Brazil)|Estado Novo]], Mesquita Filho was arrested several times and once again forced into exhile, spending many years in [[Paris]] and [[Buenos Aires]]. With the advent of the [[Fourth Brazilian Republic]], Mesquita Filho positioned himself as an opponent of the populist [[Brazilian Labour Party (1945)|Brazilian Labour Party]] as well as a critic of the conservative [[National Democratic Union (Brazil)|National Democratic Union]].
In 1964, Mesquita Filho supported the military [[1964 Brazilian coup d'état|coup d'état]] that deposed [[João Goulart]], instituting a dictatorship.
In 1964, Mesquita Filho supported the military [[1964 Brazilian coup d'état|coup d'état]] that deposed [[João Goulart]], instituting a provisional government. However, following the issuance of the Institutional Act n.º 2 ([[:pt:Ato_Institucional_n.º_2|pt]]), which signaled the government was moving towards a [[Military dictatorship in Brazil|dictatorship]], Mesquita Filho came to an overt opposition, which led to his newspaper being censored after the [[Institutional Act Number Five|Institutional Act n.º 5]].

He died in July 1969, aged 77, after a gastric surgery.

'''Alina Șerban''' (born October 29, 1987) is a Romanian Romani actress, the winner of the Best Actress Award<ref>{{cite AV media |date=14 September 2020 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f0McBnqXf_E |title=Alina Șerban - Best Actress Award at The Actors Guild Awards in 2020 |publisher=Alina Serban |via=[[YouTube]] |access-date=5 October 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200915234939/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f0McBnqXf_E |archive-date=15 September 2020 |url-status=live}}</ref> at the [[:de:Deutscher Schauspielpreis|German Actors Guild Awards]]<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.rtl.de/cms/deutscher-schauspielpreis-2020-alina-serban-ausgezeichnet-4612305.html|title=Deutscher Schauspielpreis 2020: Alina Serban ausgezeichnet}}</ref> in 2020 for her leading role in ''Gipsy Queen'',<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt6593706/|title = Gipsy Queen (2019)| website=[[IMDb]] }}</ref> a nominee for Best Actress at the [[German Film Award]] in 2020, a representative for [[Romania]] at [[Cannes International Film Festival|The Cannes International Film Festival]] in 2018<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://life.ro/alina-serban-la-festivalul-de-film-de-la-cannes/|title = Alina Şerban la Festivalul de film de la Cannes|date = 10 May 2018}}</ref> for her leading role in [[Alone at My Wedding]], and the first Roma woman theatre and film director of Romania.
'''Alina Șerban''' (born October 29, 1987) is a Romanian Romani actress, the winner of the Best Actress Award<ref>{{cite AV media |date=14 September 2020 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f0McBnqXf_E |title=Alina Șerban - Best Actress Award at The Actors Guild Awards in 2020 |publisher=Alina Serban |via=[[YouTube]] |access-date=5 October 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200915234939/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f0McBnqXf_E |archive-date=15 September 2020 |url-status=live}}</ref> at the [[:de:Deutscher Schauspielpreis|German Actors Guild Awards]]<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.rtl.de/cms/deutscher-schauspielpreis-2020-alina-serban-ausgezeichnet-4612305.html|title=Deutscher Schauspielpreis 2020: Alina Serban ausgezeichnet}}</ref> in 2020 for her leading role in ''Gipsy Queen'', a nominee for Best Actress at the [[German Film Award]] in 2020, a representative for [[Romania]] at [[Cannes International Film Festival|The Cannes International Film Festival]] in 2018<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://life.ro/alina-serban-la-festivalul-de-film-de-la-cannes/|title = Alina Şerban la Festivalul de film de la Cannes|date = 10 May 2018}}</ref> for her leading role in [[Alone at My Wedding]], and the first Roma woman theatre and film director of Romania.


The first in her family to graduate high-school, she attended the [[Tisch School of the Arts]] in New York, graduated from the [[I. L. Caragiale National University of Theatre and Film]] and has a master's degree from [[Royal Academy of Dramatic Art]] in London.
The first in her family to graduate high-school, she attended the [[Tisch School of the Arts]] in New York, graduated from the [[I. L. Caragiale National University of Theatre and Film]] and has a master's degree from [[Royal Academy of Dramatic Art]] in London.


Șerban is known for writing and performing plays with [[social justice]] messages, against [[sexism]], [[racism]], [[homophobia]] and various other forms of [[discrimination]].<ref>{{cite web |url= http://adevarul.ro/news/societate/adevarul-live-ora-1100-lupta-actrita-romanca-etnie-roma-stereotipurile-marea-britanie-1_52ce4aa0c7b855ff56538a17/index.html |title= Alina Şerban, actriţă româncă de etnie romă: "În Marea Britanie, m-au întrebat dacă sunt Esmeralda"|publisher= Adevarul |accessdate=}}</ref>
Șerban is known for writing and performing plays with [[social justice]] messages, against [[sexism]], [[racism]], [[homophobia]] and various other forms of [[discrimination]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://adevarul.ro/news/societate/adevarul-live-ora-1100-lupta-actrita-romanca-etnie-roma-stereotipurile-marea-britanie-1_52ce4aa0c7b855ff56538a17/index.html|title= Alina Şerban, actriţă româncă de etnie romă: "În Marea Britanie, m-au întrebat dacă sunt Esmeralda"|publisher= Adevarul}}</ref>


==Biography==
==Biography==
Alina Șerban was born in 1987 in a Romanian [[Romani people|Roma]] family in [[Bucharest]], [[Romania]]. She was 8 years old when her parents lost their home and were forced to move to her father’s extended family. A few years later her mother went to prison and Alina spent her teenage years in a children's home from where she went directly to the university. She used her diaries from those years to write the early versions of ''I Declare at My Own Risk'', ''Slumdog Roma'' and ''Two weeks, maximum one month, maybe six years''<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.criticatac.ro/7315/%E2%80%9Esunt-alina-serban-sunt-de-etnie-roma-si-nu-vreau-sa-ma-tratez%E2%80%9D/ |title= Sunt Alina Şerban, sunt de etnie romă şi nu vreau să mă tratez |publisher= Critic Atac|accessdate=}}</ref> – which she performed at the International Romani Art Festival in 2009 and 2010.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.iraf.ro/en/pagina/istoric.html |title= Istoric |publisher= IRAF |accessdate= |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20160403042733/http://www.iraf.ro/en/pagina/istoric.html |archive-date= 2016-04-03 |url-status= dead }}</ref>
Alina Șerban was born in 1987 in a Romanian [[Romani people|Roma]] family in [[Bucharest]], [[Romania]]. She was 8 years old when her parents lost their home and were forced to move to her father’s extended family. A few years later her mother went to prison and Alina spent her teenage years in a children's home from where she went directly to the university. She used her diaries from those years to write the early versions of ''I Declare at My Own Risk'', ''Slumdog Roma'' and ''Two weeks, maximum one month, maybe six years''<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.criticatac.ro/7315/%E2%80%9Esunt-alina-serban-sunt-de-etnie-roma-si-nu-vreau-sa-ma-tratez%E2%80%9D/ |title= Sunt Alina Şerban, sunt de etnie romă şi nu vreau să mă tratez |publisher= Critic Atac}}</ref> – which she performed at the International Romani Art Festival in 2009 and 2010.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.iraf.ro/en/pagina/istoric.html |title=Istoric |publisher=IRAF|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160403042733/http://www.iraf.ro/en/pagina/istoric.html |archive-date=2016-04-03 |url-status=dead}}</ref>


In 2011 Șerban received a scholarship and moved to London for a master’s program at the [[Royal Academy of Dramatic Art]]. The following year she received the "Best Romanian Student in the UK”, prize, but she could not afford the expenses associated with the trip from [[London]] to [[Edinburgh]] so she could not pick up the prize in person.
In 2011 Șerban received a scholarship and moved to London for a master’s program at the [[Royal Academy of Dramatic Art]]. The following year she received the "Best Romanian Student in the UK”, prize, but she could not afford the expenses associated with the trip from [[London]] to [[Edinburgh]] so she could not pick up the prize in person.
Line 29: Line 29:
In March 2014 the actress was invited to the [[Street Child World Cup]] to give a speech in front of 2000 people at [[Royal Albert Hall]].<ref>{{cite AV media |date=29 January 2015 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7atNKiwQcqM |title=Alina Serban, actress - "Street Child World Cup" |publisher=Barbu Razvan |via=[[YouTube]] |access-date=5 October 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210203043551/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7atNKiwQcqM |archive-date=3 February 2021 |url-status=live}}</ref> In 2016 Alina Şerban published the first ''Collection of Roma Fairy Tales'' in Romania, as told by her aunt – Tanti Veta.
In March 2014 the actress was invited to the [[Street Child World Cup]] to give a speech in front of 2000 people at [[Royal Albert Hall]].<ref>{{cite AV media |date=29 January 2015 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7atNKiwQcqM |title=Alina Serban, actress - "Street Child World Cup" |publisher=Barbu Razvan |via=[[YouTube]] |access-date=5 October 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210203043551/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7atNKiwQcqM |archive-date=3 February 2021 |url-status=live}}</ref> In 2016 Alina Şerban published the first ''Collection of Roma Fairy Tales'' in Romania, as told by her aunt – Tanti Veta.


She played the lead role and contributed as a script consultant for three European film projects focusing on experiences of Roma women: ''Written/Unwritten'',<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt7336694/|title = Scris/Nescris (Short 2016)| website=[[IMDb]] }}</ref> [[Alone at My Wedding]] and ''Gipsy Queen''.
She played the lead role and contributed as a script consultant for three European film projects focusing on experiences of Roma women: ''Written/Unwritten'', [[Alone at My Wedding]] and ''Gipsy Queen''.


For her first leading role in cinema, Șerban starred in Marta Bergman’s feature film [[Alone at My Wedding]], which premiered at the Cannes International Film Festival in 2018 and earned her several Best Actress awards.
For her first leading role in cinema, Șerban starred in Marta Bergman’s feature film [[Alone at My Wedding]], which premiered at the Cannes International Film Festival in 2018 and earned her several Best Actress awards.

As per the [[Kannada language]], The word "Jayanagar" when split into two words, [[Victory|Jaya]] and [[City|nagar]]<nowiki/>a literally makes it ''Victory City''. It is not definitively known why that is. One school of thought is that ''Jaya'' comes from [[Mysore]]'s [[Maharaja]] [[Jayachamarajendra Wadiyar]].{{cn|date=March 2022}}
As per the [[Kannada language]], The word "Jayanagar" when split into two words, [[Victory|Jaya]] and [[City|nagar]]<nowiki/>a literally makes it ''Victory City''. It is not definitively known why that is. One school of thought is that ''Jaya'' comes from [[Mysore]]'s [[Maharaja]] [[Jayachamarajendra Wadiyar]].{{cn|date=March 2022}}


The foundation of Jayanagara was laid in the year 1948.<ref name="thehindu1">{{cite web|author=T. S. Ranganna |url=http://www.thehindu.com/news/cities/bangalore/oldworld-charm-sadly-eroded/article4656604.ece |title=Old-world charm sadly eroded |work=[[The Hindu]] |date=2013-04-26 |access-date=2013-04-30}}</ref> It was one of the first planned neighbourhoods in Bengaluru, and at the time, the largest in Asia.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.thehindu.com/real-estate/the-top-five-expensive-neighbourhoods-in-bangalore/article19445345.ece|title=The top five expensive neighbourhoods in Bangalore|last=Roofandfloor|date=2017-08-14|work=The Hindu|access-date=2019-01-14|language=en-IN|issn=0971-751X}}</ref>{{citation needed|date=March 2014}}

Jayanagara was traditionally regarded as the southern end of Bengaluru. The "[[List of Namma Metro stations|South End Circle]]", where six roads meet, and the historic [[Ashoka Pillar]] (which was to mark the southern end) bear this fact. While newer extensions have taken away this distinction from Jayanagara, it remains one of the more southern parts of the city.

source_payload.html:
Draft:Suman KC (singer) added to category

New page

Suman KC (born 22 October 1988) is a Nepali playback singer originally from Pyuthan, Nepal. He is known for his work in contemporary Nepali music. He gained national media attention beginning in 2021 through a series of song releases and music videos that were covered by established Nepali news and entertainment outlets.

== Career ==
Suman KC has been active in the Nepali music industry since the early 2020s. He began receiving wider public and media recognition in 2021 following the release of multiple songs and collaborations that were featured by national media in Nepal.

Throughout his career, he has collaborated with several singers from Nepal and India. His collaborations include works with Nepali singers such as Melina Rai, Prabisha Adhikari, Annu Chaudhary, Rachana Rimal, Asmita Adhikari, Samikshya Adhikari, Deepa Lama, Elina Chauhan, Anju Pant, Prena Singh, and Rojina Basnet. He has also collaborated with Indian playback singers Deepa Narayan Jha and Sanjeevani Bhelande.

His musical works and collaborations have been reported by independent Nepali media outlets including Setopati, Ratopati, Nepal Press, and Celebrity Nepal.

== Discography ==

=== Selected songs ===

* Bagama
* Mayako Phoolbari
* Dhadkan Bhitra
* Natungine Kinara

== Years active ==

* 2021–present

== References ==
<references><ref>{{cite web |title=मेलिना र सुमनको ‘मायाको फूलबारी’ गीत सार्वजनिक |url=https://www.setopati.com/art/art-activity/223483 |website=Setopati |language=ne}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web |title=मेलिना र सुमन केसीको ‘मायाको फूलबारी’ |url=https://www.ratopati.com |website=Ratopati |language=ne}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web |title=सुमन केसी र अनु चौधरीको नयाँ गीत ‘धड्कन भित्र’ सार्वजनिक |url=https://www.ratopati.com/story/410499/song |website=Ratopati |language=ne}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web |title=नयाँ म्युजिक भिडियो सार्वजनिक |url=https://www.nepalpress.com |website=Nepal Press |language=ne}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web |title=सुमन र मेलिनाको ‘बागमा’ सार्वजनिक |url=https://celebritynepal.com |website=Celebrity Nepal |language=ne}}</ref></references>

By March 2010, the Eurocodes are mandatory for the specification of European public works and are intended to become the [[de facto standard]] for the private sector. The Eurocodes therefore replace the existing national [[building code]]s published by national standard bodies (e.g. [[BS 5950]]), although many countries had a period of co-existence.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last= |date=2007-11-01 |title=Eurocodes: ready in 2008 - but are you? |url=https://www.newcivilengineer.com/archive/eurocodes-ready-in-2008-but-are-you-01-11-2007/ |access-date=2023-02-11 |magazine=[[New Civil Engineer]] |language=en}}</ref> Additionally, each country is expected to issue a National Annex to the Eurocodes which will need referencing for a particular country (e.g. The UK National Annex). At present, take-up of Eurocodes is slow on private sector projects and existing national codes are still widely used by engineers.

== Casualties and unverified reports in the fog of war ==
== Casualties and unverified reports in the fog of war ==
A total of 101 Israeli civilians were killed in the attack. The victims included an 80-year-old man whose fingers had been cut off, multiple elderly people and a naked teenager found dead in the rubble.<ref name="The New York Times"/> In addition, 31 Israeli security personnel were killed, of whom 18 were IDF soldiers, 5 were members of the kibbutz security team, and 8 were police officers. Many soldiers and civilians were also wounded. In addition, 32 Israeli civilians were abducted from Be'eri and taken to the Gaza Strip as hostages, of whom 30 were members of the kibbutz and two were civilians who had fled the [[Re'im music festival massacre]] and were taken captive in the area.
A total of 101 Israeli civilians were killed in the attack. The victims included an 80-year-old man whose fingers had been cut off, multiple elderly people and a naked teenager found dead in the rubble.<ref name="The New York Times"/> In addition, 31 Israeli security personnel were killed, of whom 18 were IDF soldiers, 8 were police officers, and 5 were members of the kibbutz security team. Many soldiers and civilians were also wounded. In addition, 32 Israeli civilians were abducted from Be'eri and taken to the Gaza Strip as hostages, of whom 30 were members of the kibbutz and two were civilians who had fled the [[Re'im music festival massacre]] and were taken captive in the area.

As of October 2024, Novo Nordisk was the second most valuable drug company in the world by market capitalization, second only to its competitor [[Eli Lilly and Company]].<ref name="Barnes">{{cite news |last1=Barnes |first1=Oliver |title=Can Eli Lilly become the first $1tn drugmaker? |url=https://www.ft.com/content/ed81ca79-1fd6-48ea-8e50-246d0849c3f5 |work=Financial Times |date=October 2, 2024 |url-access=subscription}}</ref> By July 2025, Novo Nordisk had fallen to become the fifth most valuable drug company amid rising competition from generic weight loss substitutes. The company named Maziar Mike Doustdar as the new CEO, effective August 7, 2025.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Chopping |first=Peter Loftus and Dominic |title=Novo Nordisk Shares Plummet as Competition Weighs on Sales |url=https://www.wsj.com/business/earnings/novo-nordisk-stock-earnings-q2-2025-b12fb01c |access-date=2025-07-29 |website=WSJ |date=29 July 2025 |language=en-US}}</ref>
As of October 2024, Novo Nordisk was the second most valuable drug company in the world by market capitalization, second only to its competitor [[Eli Lilly and Company]].<ref name="Barnes">{{cite news |last1=Barnes |first1=Oliver |title=Can Eli Lilly become the first $1tn drugmaker? |url=https://www.ft.com/content/ed81ca79-1fd6-48ea-8e50-246d0849c3f5 |work=Financial Times |date=October 2, 2024 |url-access=subscription}}</ref> By July 2025, Novo Nordisk had fallen to become the fifth most valuable drug company amid rising competition from generic weight loss substitutes. The company named Maziar Mike Doustdar as the new CEO, effective August 7, 2025.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Chopping |first=Peter Loftus and Dominic |title=Novo Nordisk Shares Plummet as Competition Weighs on Sales |url=https://www.wsj.com/business/earnings/novo-nordisk-stock-earnings-q2-2025-b12fb01c |access-date=2025-07-29 |website=WSJ |date=29 July 2025 |language=en-US}}</ref>

[[File:P20251106AM-1755 President Donald Trump makes an announcement on lowering drug prices in the Oval Office.jpg|thumb|Doustdar during a meeting with Donald Trump in the Oval Office in November 2025]]
In March 2025, the company announced new plans for a direct-to-consumer offering of its Wegovy weight loss drug. The company established a new pharmacy, called NovoCare, which would charge customers $499 per month for access to the drug, less than half the cost of the drug through other pharmaceutical distribution networks.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Constantino |first=Annika Kim |date=2025-03-05 |title=Novo Nordisk offers Wegovy for less than half the price through new direct-to-consumer pharmacy |url=https://www.cnbc.com/2025/03/05/novo-nordisk-offers-discounted-wegovy-through-direct-to-consumer-pharmacy.html |access-date=2025-04-07 |website=CNBC |language=en}}</ref>

'''Nodding disease''', also known as '''nodding syndrome''', is a mentally and physically disabling disease that affects children aged 3 and above, continuing into adulthood.<ref name=miettaux/> It was first described in 1962 in secluded mountainous regions of [[Tanzania]], with sporadic outbreaks in the decades since in [[South Sudan]], [[Uganda]], and again in Sudan with its largest outbreak from 2016 to present.<ref name=miettaux/><ref name="irinnews">{{cite news| title=Nodding disease or 'river epilepsy'? |author=<!--not stated-->|publisher=IRIN Africa| date=10 August 2009 | url=http://www.irinnews.org/report/85646/uganda-nodding-disease-or-river-epilepsy | archive-url=http://web.archive.org/web/20190217030145/http://www.irinnews.org/report/85646/uganda-nodding-disease-or-river-epilepsy | archive-date=17 February 2019 }}</ref><ref name="Nature" /><ref name="CNN">{{cite news| last=McKenzie | first=David | title=Mysterious nodding disease debilitates children | publisher=CNN | date=19 March 2012 | url=https://edition.cnn.com/2012/03/19/world/africa/uganda-nodding-disease/index.html}}</ref> Since 2019 cases have been identified in the [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]], [[Central African Republic]] and [[Cameroon]].
'''Nodding disease''', also known as '''nodding syndrome''', is a mentally and physically disabling disease that affects children aged 3 and above, continuing into adulthood.<ref name=miettaux/> It was first described in 1962 in secluded mountainous regions of [[Tanzania]], with sporadic outbreaks in the decades since in [[South Sudan]], [[Uganda]], and again in Sudan with its largest outbreak from 2016 to present.<ref name=miettaux/><ref name="irinnews">{{cite news | title=Nodding disease or 'river epilepsy'? | author=<!--not stated--> | publisher=IRIN Africa | date=10 August 2009 | url=http://www.irinnews.org/report/85646/uganda-nodding-disease-or-river-epilepsy | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190217030145/http://www.irinnews.org/report/85646/uganda-nodding-disease-or-river-epilepsy | archive-date=17 February 2019 | access-date=25 March 2024 | url-status=live }}</ref><ref name="Nature" /><ref name="CNN">{{cite news| last=McKenzie | first=David | title=Mysterious nodding disease debilitates children | publisher=CNN | date=19 March 2012 | url=https://edition.cnn.com/2012/03/19/world/africa/uganda-nodding-disease/index.html}}</ref> Since 2019 cases have been identified in the [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]], [[Central African Republic]] and [[Cameroon]].


Its cause is unknown, and no cure yet exists.<ref name=miettaux>{{cite news| last=Miettaux | first=Florence | title=The fight to cure South Sudan's mysterious neurological disorder | newspaper=The Guardian | date=25 March 2024 | url=https://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2024/mar/25/cure-nodding-syndrome-south-sudan-children-neurological-disorder-blackfly-onchocerciasis-river-blindness-link}}</ref>
Its cause is unknown, and no cure yet exists.<ref name=miettaux>{{cite news| last=Miettaux | first=Florence | title=The fight to cure South Sudan's mysterious neurological disorder | newspaper=The Guardian | date=25 March 2024 | url=https://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2024/mar/25/cure-nodding-syndrome-south-sudan-children-neurological-disorder-blackfly-onchocerciasis-river-blindness-link}}</ref>

The genus name of ''Ruehssia'' is in honour of Carl Andreas Rühsz (1805–1880), the German consul in [[Puerto Cabello]], Venezuela. He was a supporter of art and science.<ref>{{cite book | last=Burkhardt | first=Lotte | title=Verzeichnis eponymischer Pflanzennamen – Erweiterte Edition |trans-title=Index of Eponymic Plant Names – Extended Edition | publisher=Botanic Garden and Botanical Museum, Freie Universität Berlin | year=2018 | isbn=978-3-946292-26-5 | url=https://doi.org/10.3372/epolist2018 |format=pdf |language=German |location=Berlin | doi=10.3372/epolist2018 | s2cid=187926901 |access-date=1 January 2021}}</ref>
The genus name of ''Ruehssia'' is in honour of Carl Andreas Rühsz (1805–1880), the German consul in [[Puerto Cabello]], Venezuela. He was a supporter of art and science.<ref>{{cite book | last=Burkhardt | first=Lotte | title=Verzeichnis eponymischer Pflanzennamen – Erweiterte Edition |trans-title=Index of Eponymic Plant Names – Extended Edition | publisher=Botanic Garden and Botanical Museum, Freie Universität Berlin | year=2018 | isbn=978-3-946292-26-5 | url=https://doi.org/10.3372/epolist2018 |format=pdf |language=German |location=Berlin | doi=10.3372/epolist2018 | s2cid=187926901 |access-date=1 January 2021}}</ref>
It was first described and published in Verh. Vereins Beförd. Gartenbaues Königl. Preuss. Staaten Vol.19 on page 304 in 1849.<ref name="POWO"/>

New page

{{Short description|Species of beetle}}
{{Speciesbox
| image =
| image_caption =
| image2 =
| image2_caption =
| genus= Neoserica
| species = farsilis
| authority = ([[Ernst Brenske|Brenske]], 1901)
| synonyms =
*''Lepiserica farsilis'' <small>Brenske, 1901</small>
*''Autoserica farsilis''
}}
'''''Neoserica farsilis''''' is a species of [[beetle]] of the family [[Scarabaeidae]].<ref>[https://www.biolib.cz/en/taxon/id1225635/ BioLib]</ref> It is found in [[Tanzania]].<ref name=":1">{{cite web |last= Schoolmeesters|first= P.|date= 2025|title= ''Neoserica (Autoserica) farsilis'' at Catalogue of Life|url=https://www.catalogueoflife.org/data/taxon/CL3TL|website= World Scarabaeidae Database (version 2025-10-07). In O. Bánki, Y. Roskov, M. Döring, G. Ower, D. R. Hernández Robles, C. A. Plata Corredor, T. Stjernegaard Jeppesen, A. Örn, T. Pape, D. Hobern, S. Garnett, H. Little, R. E. DeWalt, J. Miller, T. Orrell, & R. Aalbu, Catalogue of Life (2026-01-16).|location= Amsterdam, Netherlands|publisher= Catalogue of Life Foundation|access-date=February 6, 2026}}</ref><ref name=":2" />

==Description==
Adults reach a length of about 10.5 mm. They are robustly built, and have a brownish-red colour with a greenish-dark sheen. They are dull and opalescent. The [[pronotum]] is only slightly rounded at the sides, not projected anteriorly, with distinct [[setae]] behind the anterior margin, the same being weak at the lateral margin. The scutellum is large, pointed, covered with the same hairs as the base of the [[elytra]]. The elytra are punctate in rows. The spaces between the setae are of unequal width. The first one next to the seam is wide, the second narrow, and so on, alternating. All are sparsely dotted, the narrow ones are somewhat more convex and black-spotted. The setae are very distinct.<ref name=":2">{{cite journal|last1=Brenske|first1=E.|date= 1901|title= Die Serica-Arten der Erde. V.|url=https://www.zobodat.at/pdf/Berliner-Ent-Zeitschrift_46_0187-0234.pdf|journal=Berliner Entomologische Zeitschrift|volume= 46|issue=2-3|publisher= |pages= 187-234|doi= |access-date= February 6, 2026}} {{pd-notice}}</ref>
